p: No infiltrations were noted on the initial and 3 follow-up chest X-ray images ( Fig. 2B). However, chest computed tomography (CT) showed patchy or nodular consolidations with peripheral ground glass opacities in subpleural areas of the right lower lobe ( Fig. 2C). The patient had no underlying disease and the only symptoms she presented with were low-grade fever and a small amount of sputum. Although chest CT showed mild pneumonia, antiviral therapy was not required.
